revised_title: A 17th-century Account of Bulimia and Its Effects
tldr: A laborer in Stanton experienced an inordinate appetite, eating excessive amounts of food, including meats and herbs. He also passed worms, as long as tobacco pipes, before his appetite declined. This case study provides insight into the effects of bulimia in the 17th century.
scientific_discipline: Medicine and Health Sciences > Physiology > Eating Disorders
